ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Misophonia
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Specific triggers (chewing, breathing, hiccups) eliciting extreme emotional distress (rage, disgust), visual triggers, and severe scores on misophonia questionnaires.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Reduced uncomfortable loudness levels (UCLs 70-90 dB HL) indicating mild-to-moderate loudness hyperacusis.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Anxiety and Depression
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Diagnosed by a clinical psychologist and linked to the effects of the triggering sounds.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the ear canals and tympanic membranes for any visible pathology.
To evaluate hearing sensitivity and rule out hearing loss.
To measure uncomfortable loudness levels and assess for hyperacusis.
To quantify the severity of misophonia and assess emotional and coping responses.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with normal hearing sensitivity but reduced sound tolerance consistent with mild-to-moderate hyperacusis. Questionnaire results confirm severe misophonia with intense emotional reactions and visual triggers.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Clear ear canals with intact tympanic membranes bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Hearing sensitivity within normal limits bilaterally (thresholds 0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Sound Tolerance (UCL)
tests.result_summary: Thresholds obtained from 70 to 90 dB HL, indicating mild-to-moderate hyperacusis.

tests.name: Questionnaires
tests.result_summary: A-MISO-S score 17 (Severe); MAQ score 48 (Severe); reports of visual triggers and severe emotional distress (hate, anger, rage).

proposed_items: Reduction of hearing protection use to avoid silence.
Sound therapy using nonoccluding devices playing pink noise.
Enrichment of sound environment (music, nature sounds) at the dinner table.
Jastreboff protocol for treatment of sound sensitivity (desensitization).
Desensitization using positive stimuli (Marvel movies) paired with trigger sounds.
counseling_actions: Explained that overuse of hearing protection can heighten sound sensitivity.
Described the reaction as a conditioned reflex involving auditory and limbic/autonomic connections.
Counseled family to keep lines of communication open regarding self-harm.
Advised transition from hearing protection to an enriched sound environment.

escalation.rationale_short: Ongoing management of misophonia and hyperacusis with sound therapy and desensitization protocols.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Follow-up after 16 months (November 2018) and subsequently in February 2019.
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor treatment progress, re-evaluate UCLs and questionnaire scores, and adjust desensitization protocols.

expected_outcome: Follow-up audiometric testing (Fig. 27.2) demonstrated improvement in uncomfortable loudness levels (UCL) following intervention.
Misophonia Coping Response revealed visual triggers were no longer an issue.
Misophonia Emotional Response Questionnaire yielded less emotional distress than previously reported.
Patient is able to sit at the dinner table for at least part of the meal without distress.
Patient returned to school part-time with intent to transition to full-time.
